alert.note: Alert for Iowa; Johnson (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 24 at 12:32PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Keokuk, Johnson, northern Washington and Iowa Counties through 115 PM CDT... At 1231 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Parnell, or 13 miles south of Marengo, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Parnell around 1235 PM CDT. Williamsburg and Conroy around 1240 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Oxford, Coralville, Tiffin, Iowa City, North Liberty, Solon, University Heights, Oakdale and Lake Macbride State Park. This includes the following highways... Interstate 80 in Iowa between mile markers 209 and 245. Interstate 380 between mile markers 1 and 11. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
